summary:
Arthritis is a general term for over 100 types of joint disorders. Common symptoms include joint pain, stiffness, and swelling. The two most typical types are osteoarthritis, which is age-related and affects larger joints, and rheumatoid arthritis, an autoimmune disease impacting hands and feet.

Treatment varies; it may include rest, ice/heat therapy, weight loss, exercise, and medication. Some severe cases might require joint replacement. Arthritis is widespread, affecting many people worldwide, especially as they age.
title: Arthritis
